template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an end-to-end content campaign task in the {industry} space that involves research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals; output only the prompt text under 45 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an end-to-end content campaign task in the education space that involves research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals; output only the prompt text under 45 words.

message.content: Create a multi-channel educational campaign about financial literacy, starting with foundational research, developing blog posts, videos, and social graphics that maintain a consistent voice, and aiming to increase course sign-ups by 15%.
message.reasoning_content:
Hmm, the user wants a concise single-sentence prompt under 45 words for an education content campaign. It needs to cover research, multi-format creation, cross-channel consistency, and measurable goals. 

Let me break down the requirements: research (foundation), multi-format (varied content types), consistency (unified messaging), and measurable goals (tracking outcomes). The education space should be implied rather than explicitly stated to save words. 

I can structure it as a task starting with research, then content creation across formats, followed by channel alignment, and ending with goal-setting. Keeping it under 45 words means trimming redundancy while hitting all four key elements. 

The current draft flows logically from groundwork to execution to measurement, fitting the word limit. It avoids jargon while clearly outlining the campaign scope.
